subtitle: Serve this seafood fondue with tartare sauce, a selection of dips and a mixed salad.

method.text: Put the water, carrots, onion, celery, bouquet garni, half the peppercorns, 1 bay leaf and dry white wine into a large pan. Slowly bring to the boil. Simmer for 1 hour then strain. Allow to cool.
Cut the fish into thin slices or cubes. Divide the fish between individual plates.

Fill the fondue pan <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub>-<sup>2</sup>/<sub>3</sub> full with the prepared court bouillon. Bring to the boil. Then carefully transfer the fondue pan to its lighted spirit stove. Simmer over a medium flare, then add the remaining peppercorns, bay leaves and small sprigs of herbs.
Individually cook the fish in the simmering bouillon for a few minutes and consume immediately.

title: Seafood fondue
